applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is specifically about an Executive Pension Life Cover Scheme, which is a death benefit scheme providing benefits to dependants if the member dies before retirement age. This is fundamentally different from permanent health insurance (PHI) which provides disability benefits. 2) The document makes no mention of disability benefits or disability payments - it only covers death benefits. 3) The scheme described is structured as an occupational pension scheme under the Pensions Act and TCA, not as a permanent health insurance policy. 4) The benefits described are lump sum death benefits and dependants' pensions, not disability income. The regulation specifically applies to permanent health insurance policies of class 4/IV, which this product clearly is not. The document is unambiguously about a different type of insurance product (life cover) with different purposes and benefits than those covered by this regulation.
regulation_title: Information to be provided about permanent health insurance
regulation_text: 333. (1) Prior to a consumer completing a proposal form for a permanent health insurance policy, an insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall explain the following to a consumer: (a) the meaning of disability as defined in the policy; (b) any benefit available under the policy; (c) the exclusions that apply to the policy; (d) any reduction applied to any available benefit if the consumer receives a disability payment from another source. (2) In this Regulation, "permanent health insurance policy" means a policy of insurance of class 4 as set out in Schedule 2 to the Insurance and Reinsurance Regulations, or class IV as set out in Annex I to the European Communities (Life Assurance) Framework R egulations 1994 .
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
